other_tests.findings: Cytopathology was positive for malignant cells, with neoplastic cells arranged in syncytia and some single cells present, showing plasmacytoid features.
Strong, diffuse immunostaining for calcitonin was observed in histopathology, favoring the diagnosis of medullary thyroid cancer.
Histopathology confirmed a 2.6 x 2.0 x 1.2 cm medullary thyroid carcinoma, confined to the thyroid gland with all lymph nodes negative for malignancy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, serum calcitonin has remained undetectable, CEA has remained within the reference range, and procalcitonin has become undetectable.

other_tests.findings: No deleterious mutations were found, ruling out the presence of a germline mutation or diagnosis of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia.
